column1: King of Eagles was a title given to Thorondor
column2: the gigantic and noble eagle of the First Age
column3: whose talons wounded the face of Morgoth himself. Thorondor dwelt among the peaks of the Crissaegrim
column4: guarding Turgons Hidden City of Gondolin from the forces of Morgoth until that citys Fall
column5: and he came to the aid of the Elves many times during the First Age.

column2: we meet a character who carries the title Lord of Eagles
column3: a title that was also borne by Thorondor in the Elder Days. Whether the title of King of Eagles was also passed down through the Ages like this cannot be known - in J.R.R. Tolkiens other writings
column4: it is only ever used of Thorondor himself.
